current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To provide for greater oversight of Department of Defense service contracts.

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

has spent more than $2,000,000,000,000 on service

text.#text: Since 2002, the

The decade-long trend of outsourcing work has created a shadow government of service contractors
			 that are largely dependent on the taxpayers as their sole source of
			 revenue.

Studies show that service contractors can cost taxpayers up to twice what it costs for members of
			 the Armed Forces to perform the work.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
spent nearly $180,000,000,000 on service contractors, making it
			 the largest buyer of services in the Federal Government.

text.#text: In 2013, the

Approximately 30 percent of the intelligence community workforce is made up of service contractors,
			 employees that work for companies whose primary goal is to
			 make a profit and have never sworn an oath to defend and protect the
			 United States.
